message.content:
To copy the content of a cell in LibreOffice Calc, you can use the following formula:

```=A1```
            
Where A1 is the cell that contains the text or value you want to copy. If A1 is "Hello World", then this formula will display "Hello World" in the current cell.

To remove all single quotes from the copied content, you can use the following formula:

```=SUBSTITUTE(A1,"'","")```
            
This will replace all instances of single quote (') with an empty string, effectively removing them from the text. You can then copy and paste this formula into any cell to remove all single quotes from the content of A1.


So if A1 contains "I don't know", the above formula would display "I don't know" without the single quote in the current cell.
